Package chirp.me.in.utils

Class FirebaseHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • chirp.me.in.utils.FirebaseHelper
  • public class FirebaseHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Used as a helper for all firebase interactions: Authentication Communication protocol between Android and Web Applications

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      FirebaseHelper​(android.content.Context context)
      Construct a firebase helper, initializing constants, filepaths, and recording helper

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void initPollingProcedure​(com.google.firebase.auth.FirebaseUser user, android.content.Context context)
      Initializes the snapshot listener by first pushing the current user profile to the database, setting the user's flag to "idle", then adding a snapshot listener to the user's document within the database.
      void pushUser​(com.google.firebase.auth.FirebaseUser user, OnSuccessCallback onSuccessCallback)
      push firebase user to db, merging with existing user if already in db
      void updateFlag​(com.google.firebase.auth.FirebaseUser user, OnSuccessCallback onSuccessCallback, int flag)
      update user's flag in firebase
      void updateLatency​(com.google.firebase.auth.FirebaseUser user, OnSuccessCallback onSuccessCallback, long latency)
      update user's latency on firebase - DEPRECATED - latency calculation is now only needed locally, as mobile app is doing the sound recognition protocol
      void updateMetrics​(com.google.firebase.auth.FirebaseUser user, OnSuccessCallback onSuccessCallback, double slope, double r2)
      update user's metrics for detected sound in firebase (both slope and r^2), primarily used for debugging, as current protocol does not require user to upload the recorded sound regression metrics

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • pushUser

        public void pushUser​(com.google.firebase.auth.FirebaseUser user,
                     OnSuccessCallback onSuccessCallback)
        push firebase user to db, merging with existing user if already in db
        Parameters:
        user - - firebase user
        onSuccessCallback - - callback to perform on successful update

      • updateFlag

        public void updateFlag​(com.google.firebase.auth.FirebaseUser user,
                       OnSuccessCallback onSuccessCallback,
                       int flag)
        update user's flag in firebase
        Parameters:
        user - - firebase user
        onSuccessCallback - - to call on success
        flag - - represent system state, see integers.xml for explanation

      • updateMetrics

        public void updateMetrics​(com.google.firebase.auth.FirebaseUser user,
                          OnSuccessCallback onSuccessCallback,
                          double slope,
                          double r2)
        update user's metrics for detected sound in firebase (both slope and r^2), primarily used for debugging, as current protocol does not require user to upload the recorded sound regression metrics
        Parameters:
        user - - firebase user
        onSuccessCallback - - to call on success
        slope - - slope of chirp in frequency domain
        r2 - - r^2 of that regression result

      • updateLatency

        public void updateLatency​(com.google.firebase.auth.FirebaseUser user,
                          OnSuccessCallback onSuccessCallback,
                          long latency)
        update user's latency on firebase - DEPRECATED - latency calculation is now only needed locally, as mobile app is doing the sound recognition protocol
        Parameters:
        user - - firebase user
        onSuccessCallback - - to call on success
        latency - - initial latency between two communications

      • initPollingProcedure

        public void initPollingProcedure​(com.google.firebase.auth.FirebaseUser user,
                                 android.content.Context context)
        Initializes the snapshot listener by first pushing the current user profile to the database, setting the user's flag to "idle", then adding a snapshot listener to the user's document within the database. Snapshot listener is defined as anonymous class within this method
        Parameters:
        user - - the firebase user to query
        context - - the calling application context
